doc:desc.p: The 'svg:tspan' children of the argument 'svg:text' element are layed- out as lines of text in a paragraph. The 'y' position coordinate is required on the first child (tspan), or all children may have the identical value for the 'y' position coordinate. This function will update the 'y' coordinate values of the second and subsequent children with an offset calculated from the first 'y' plus iterations adding 'height'.

When the 'svg:text' element has an 'x' attribute value, and any child (including the first) 'svg:tspan' element is missing an 'x' attribute, this function will create an 'x' attribute on the child 'svg:tspan' element with the value from the 'svg:text' element.

This function assumes that 'X' and 'Y' attribute values are integers, and assigns 'svg:tspan' element attribute values as strings formatted to include the 'px' (default user coordinates) length unit suffix.
This function includes code to use 'y' from the 'svg:text' element when it's missing from the 'svg:tspan' element, but this doesnt seem to work in FF at the time of this writing.

doc:param.doc:desc: An 'svg:text' element containing 'svg:tspan' children, each of which are lines in a paragraph
